summary: This is an email forwarding a Reuters news article about the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell by the FBI on Epstein-related charges. The article summarizes Maxwell's background as Epstein's confidante, the allegations against her, and provides context about Epstein's death and the legal proceedings.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: British socialite and heiress, former girlfriend and long-time associate of Jeffrey Epstein, arrested by the FBI on Epstein-related charges for allegedly helping him traffic underage girls.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Registered sex offender who was arrested on federal charges of exploiting underage girls; died by suicide in custody in August 2019; Maxwell was his confidante.

persons.name: Virginia Roberts Giuffre
persons.context: One of the teens who accused Ghislaine Maxwell of helping Epstein groom girls for sex; she leveled charges against Maxwell in a 2015 defamation suit.

persons.name: Robert Maxwell
persons.context: Father of Ghislaine Maxwell, described as a media baron.

persons.name: Jonathan Dienst
persons.context: One of the authors of the Reuters news article about Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest.

persons.name: Joe Valiquette
persons.context: One of the authors of the Reuters news article about Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest.

persons.name: Tom Winter
persons.context: One of the authors of the Reuters news article about Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest.

persons.name: Sarah Fitzpatrick
persons.context: One of the authors of the Reuters news article about Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest.

connections.description: Maxwell was Epstein's confidante, former girlfriend, and was alleged to have helped him groom and traffic underage girls for sex.
Giuffre accused Maxwell of helping Epstein groom her and other teen girls for sex, as detailed in a 2015 defamation suit.
Robert Maxwell is the father of Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Arrested
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested by the FBI on the East Coast on charges related to Jeffrey Epstein's alleged sexual crimes. She was expected to appear in federal court later that day.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide in custody in early August 2019, following a previous suicide attempt in late July 2019.

events.title: Epstein's First Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein attempted suicide in custody in late July 2019.

events.title: Epstein's Arrest
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested in the summer of 2019 on new federal charges of exploiting dozens of underage girls in New York and Florida in the early 2000s.

events.title: Epstein Deposition Transcript Released
events.description: One day before Epstein's suicide, a federal appeals court released the transcript of a 2016 deposition in which Epstein repeatedly refused to say whether Maxwell had procured young girls for him.

events.title: Giuffre Defamation Suit
events.description: Virginia Roberts Giuffre filed a defamation suit against Ghislaine Maxwell, accusing her of helping Epstein groom teen girls for sex.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell, the British socialite and confidante of Jeffrey Epstein, was arrested by the FBI on July 2, 2020, on Epstein-related charges.
Maxwell was accused in a civil suit of allegedly helping Epstein traffic underage girls and groom them for sex with the rich and powerful.
Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide in custody in August 2019 after being arrested on federal charges of exploiting dozens of underage girls.
Two guards tasked with monitoring Epstein face federal charges for not properly supervising him before his death.
A 2016 deposition transcript released just before Epstein's death showed he repeatedly refused to say whether Maxwell had procured young girls for him.
